tu.note: IMPORTANT: Native transcription of the language (e.g. Dansk, Deutsch, English). IMPORTANT: "English" should not be just translated! IMPORTANT: If the rest of the xml:lang attribute is left with the value "en", it's crucial to update the one of this entry with the correct value (e.g. fr, it, zh_CN, etc.).

Message printed while the application dependencies are loaded, while the console is being built

tuv.seg: Please, wait while the Console is being built...

tu.note: See also segement with tuid="sep_localized_page_description" Description for search engines, as it can appear to customers when they look for a service/product

tuv.seg: Twetailer users (consumers and retailers) can privately use the Twetailer Console to manage their orders. You can access your data with exisiting credentials (your identity provided will do the verification for us, Twetailer does not keep passwords) and consolidate accounts to communicate with Twetailer over many channels (Twitter, E-mail, GTalk, etc.).

tu.note: Keywords for search engines

tuv.seg: consumers, retailers, goods, services, local, postal code, range, expiration date

In order to use the Twetailer console, you need to be authenticated first. To eliminate the management of yet another set of credentials, Twetailer relies on OpenID. Consult OpendId.net website for more information on that technology.

tu.note: Text place in front of the input field that is going to receive the user's input for his custom OpenID identifier.

tuv.seg: Enter the missing part of the OpenID:

tu.note: Text place after the input field that is going to receive the user's input for his custom OpenID identifier.
This message is displayed on the login page and have no context about the visitor location See also segment with tuid="sep_other_locations_title"
This message is displayed on the login page and have no context about the visitor location See also segment with tuid="sep_other_locations_introduction"

tuv.seg: Twetailer maintains the list of the top active cities (refreshed once a day). Use the following links to see the most used keywords by retailers per city:

Twetailer is a creation of Steven Milstein and Dom Derrien. Twetailer is operated by Milstein & Associates inc.

For more information, you can join the Twetailer community at twetailer.cyn.in.
Hint: as reported by your OpenID provider.
Hint: to attach messages exchanged with maezel@twetailer.appspotmail.com with your account.
Hint: to attach instant messages exchanged with twetailer@appspot.com with your account.

Hint: to attach direct messages exchanged with twitter.com/twetailer with your account.
Note: you need to follow @twetailer on Twitter in order to be able to get direct messages from us.
Confirmation code for the Twetailer registration process

Here is the confirmation code: {0}. You have to reported it into the Welcome page for new Twetailer users.| | Thanks for shopping with Twetailer.| | If you did not initiate this notification, it's possible someone miss-associates his account and yours. If you think someone tries to spoof your account, forward this message to abusive-notification@twetailer.appspot.com.

tu.note: Information message for the screen screen at step 4, displayed when all given (and valid) identifiers match one existing account. {0}: mechanism used to send the verification code -- See entries: - consumer_info_verification_alert_email - consumer_info_message_jabber_for_verification_code - consumer_info_message_twitter_for_verification_code {1}: identifier for the third-party communication channel

tuv.seg: A verification code has been sent {0} to: {1}. Please, report it in the input field below to be able to complete the registration process.

tu.note: Information message for the screen screen at step 4, mechanism for sending confirmation codes. See entry: consumer_info_verification_alert
Information message for the screen screen at step 4, mechanism for sending confirmation codes. See entry: consumer_info_verification_alert
Information message for the screen screen at step 4, mechanism for sending confirmation codes. See entry: consumer_info_verification_alert
Generic error message presented to the Console user when there's an error while communicating with the server

tuv.seg:
Unexpected error while processing a request response. The incident is going to be reported to Twetailer analytics system.

 You can send an e-mail to incident@twetailer.appspotmail.com if the issue is crucial to you.

 Follow our communication on Twitter (@twetailer) for our open tracking of the critical issues.
Twetailer experiences issues while trying to communicate over Twitter. Please try when Twitter server is back online.
Twetailer cannot send direct messages to users who are not following it. You must follow @twetailer (http://twitter.com/twetailer) in order to use it from Twitter.

tu.note: {0}: name of the city listed on this page

See also segement with tuid="login_localized_page_description" Description for search engines, as it can appear to customers when they look for a service/product in the corresponding city {0}: name of the city listed on this page

tuv.seg: This is the Twetailer directory for the city of {0}. It lists the top provided keywords for the Twetailer retailers participating in the area. Use the form on the top to post a demand about a product or service you are looking for. Twetailer will convey it to the corresponding retailers and they'll return to you if they can help.

Wii Console pink remote control
Nikon D5000 locale:95323 US range:25mi
Day Camp for 8 years old boy locale:H2P1C4 CA expiration:2010-08-31
What do you want to buy?
You cannot submit an empty Demand. Please, describe what you are looking for with a least 3 keywords.
Series of keywords describing your request, just separated by a space
Postal code and coutry code, to generate "H1X 2C6 CA" or "94523 US".

tuv.seg: Disclaimer: Above is the list of supplied tags in the {0} area. Retailers can add/remove tags about the products and services they can propose anytime. This page is refreshed once a day. Note that retailers can propose tags without having the corresponding products in stock. Retailers will propose you goods only when they can deliver them.

tuv.seg: This is a page for the {0} area is refreshed once a day. You can also check the pages for these other cities:

The Short Message Service (SMS) is a system that allows cellphone users to send simple text messages to others.
In Canada and United States of America, you can exchange with Twetailer via SMS through its Twitter connector.
In Canada, send your message to the short code: 21212.
In United States of America, send your message to the short code: 40404.
Twetailer is open only in Canada and USA for now, but if folks want to try from another place covered by Twitter,
check this Twitter resource for an up-to-date list of short codes.
For privacy concerns, all information about your orders should be sent as a Direct Message.
So don't forget to prefix you messages with twetailer@appspot.com
With the demand tags you have specified, your message should be:
Happy shopping with Twetailer.

Google Talk (aka GTalk) is an instant messaging tool based on the standard XMPP protocol.
You can use the official GTalk for Windows or one of the listed 3rd party clients for Windows, OSX or Linux.
Mobile phone users have more choices:
Owners of any smart phone with the Android Operating System can use the official and pre-installed GTalk client.
Owners of BlackBerry phone can get the official GTalk for BlackBerry,
Owners of Nokia phones can get a client from betalabs.nokia.com
Owners of other J2ME phones can get Nimbuzz.
Once you have GTalk running:
Invite twetailer@appspot.com, and
Send the text of your demand: !
Happy shopping with Twetailer.
The message for the Demand (with its required attributes) is too long to be conveyed by Twitter.\nClick OK to send your Demand by E-Mail, or, Cancel?
